summary: This is a joint letter from the prosecution and defense in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case (20 Cr. 330) to Judge Alison J. Nathan. It provides lists of names, places, and entities that may be referenced during the trial, submitted under seal to protect privacy during jury selection (voir dire).

locations: 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida
Zorro Ranch, 39 Zorro Ranch Road, Stanley, New Mexico
9 East 71st Street, New York, New York
Little St. James Island, U.S. Virgin Islands
keyFacts: This document is a sealed joint filing from the prosecution and defense in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal trial, intended to guide jury selection by listing names, places, and entities likely to be mentioned.

The list of 26+ named individuals includes key figures like Les Wexner and Glen Dubin, staff like Juan Alessi and Lawrence Visoski (Epstein's pilot), and multiple expert witnesses like Dr. Park Dietz and Dr. Elizabeth Loftus.

Notable locations listed include Epstein's properties: his Palm Beach home (358 El Brillo Way), New Mexico ranch (Zorro Ranch), New York City townhouse (9 East 71st Street), and private island (Little St. James).
The list of entities includes 'Mar-a-Lago' (Donald Trump's Florida club) and the television show 'Days of Our Lives', indicating these may be referenced in trial testimony or evidence.
The document demonstrates the scope of the trial, showing it will involve testimony about Epstein's network of properties, staff, associates, and experts on topics like memory and forensics.
